blocks.content: IDS means Intrusion Detection System. It monitors network traffic and alerts when suspicious activity happens. In naval style, IDS is like a radar system on a warship that detects unknown ships or unusual movement in the sea.

blocks.content: A firewall controls what traffic is allowed or blocked. It is like a naval checkpoint that decides which ships can enter the harbor and which ships must stay out.

A honeypot is a fake system created to attract attackers. It is like placing a decoy ship in the sea to watch how the enemy behaves. When attackers interact with it, security teams learn their methods.

content: Fake system used to trap attackers
